channel.title: Femmes FITales
channel.description: be fit. be strong. be you.

item.title: Class Description
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Femmes Fitales is a high intensity, non-competitive, varied exercise program designed for women.  All fitness levels are welcome – you will NEVER feel like you are “too out of shape” to participate because all exercises are scaled to your ability.  The age range of the women in class is early 30’s to late 50’s.  We use weights, medicine balls, our own body weight, and whatever else may be handy to push us and make us stronger.  We emphasize core strength training, cardio, flexibility, agility and endurance.  The class format changes from week to week, and you’ll never have the same workout twice.  Class size is small, so you will get individual attention, encouragement and coaching. Where: Williamsburg Middle School, Arlington, Virginia When: 5:45 to 6:45 a.m. every weekday morning, rain or shine.  No class on Thanksgiving, Christmas, or New Year’s Day, or if Arlington County Schools are delayed or closed due to inclement weather.  Class is also canceled in the rare event of morning thunderstorms. Who: If you want to get into shape, meet fun people, and be pushed harder than you will push yourself, Femmes FITales is for you.  The class environment is inclusive and very friendly, and the only competition you have is with yourself!

item.title: FAQs
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Do I have to be a runner? No, running is an integral part of the workout, but if you are not a runner, don’t let it discourage you from joining.  It does get easier with practice and consistency. I am in terrible shape.  Should I start working out before I start your class? Absolutely not!  We welcome all fitness levels and will work with you to “ease you into” the routine.  You will be coached on how to modify exercises to meet your ability level and to build your strength and endurance gradually. What is the cost? Your first week is free.  There is a flat monthly rate of $90, which can be pro-rated if you start class mid-month.  Contracts are all month to month, so there is no long term financial commitment. Do you meet if it rains? Yes.  We meet rain or shine.  If it is raining, we will meet under an awning so you won’t get all wet.  In the event of thunderstorms, class is canceled. What should I bring to class? You need an exercise mat, a pair of dumbbells (seven or eight pounds), water, and a reflective vest (available at running stores).  The instructor will provide a medicine ball and stretch strap, which are available for purchase for $50. What should I wear to class? In warmer weather, I highly recommend moisture wicking fabric such as cool max and comfortable shorts.  In colder weather, dress in layers and wear a moisture wicking fabric closer to your body.  A good sports bra is a must.  If it is cold, dress as if it is 20 degrees warmer than the actual temperature. What about shoes? A good pair of running shoes is essential.  If you have never been fitted for running shoes, go to one of the running stores in the area (Metro Run and Walk, Pacers, Gotta Run) and have someone fit you with proper running shoes for your foot and gait.  Replace your shoes every four to six months. How do you get up that early every morning? I admit that the class time can be intimidating to a lot of people.  However, after a few weeks, your body does adjust to getting up early.  I think we meet at the best time of the day.  There is often a beautiful sunrise, or a full moon, and the morning air is fresh and crisp.  And, you are finished before 7:00 and don’t have to schedule exercise in for the rest of the day!!! Any other questions: Call me at 571-405-1050 or email me at Kristine@astonsawyer.com.

item.title: Instructor
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Kristine Aston Sawyer

Kristine is a certified Group Fitness Instructor through American Council on Exercise, a certified Level 1 Coach with Crossfit and a former “bootcamp” instructor.  She is also certified in Levels 1 – 3 and Restorative Yoga through Yogafit.  She has a passion for fitness and believes that anyone can become strong, fit and healthy if she has a willingness to challenge herself and a positive attitude. She was a dedicated ballet dancer throughout her teens and into her early twenties.  After college, she started taking aerobics classes and has always been involved in fitness of one kind or another. She is the mother of twins (born in 2003) and a college freshman.  She met her husband, Dennis, at the Marine Corps Marathon in 1999 (she was running; he was tailgating) and the following year they ran Army Ten Miler the day after their wedding, then ran the MCM together.  After both races, they vacationed in Morocco.

item.dc:creator: admin

She was a dedicated ballet dancer throughout her teens and into her early twenties. After college, she started taking aerobics classes and has always been involved in fitness of one kind or another. She is the mother of twins (born in 2003) and a college freshman. She met her husband, Dennis, at the Marine Corps Marathon in 1999 (she was running; he was tailgating) and the following year they ran Army Ten Miler the day after their wedding, then ran the MCM together. After both races, they vacationed in Morocco.

item.title: Another Stuck Inside Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Another Stuck Inside Workout – a short, but fast and challenging workout:
Get your IPod and crank up some fast music (your selections are better than mine, I’m sure!)
Warm up by doing: 20 jumping jacks 20 squats 20 mountain climbers 20 arm circles front/20 rear
Working at a fast pace, do the following:
21 Squats 21 push-ups 21 Burpees 21 Sit-ups 60 second Plank
15 Squats 15 push-ups 15 Burpees 15 Sit-ups 60 second Plank
9 Squats 9 Push-ups 9 Burpees 9 Sit-ups 60 second Plank
3 Squats 3 Push-ups 3 Burpees 3 Sit-ups 60 second Plank

item.title: Upper Body Workout with Cards
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Upper Body Workout with Cards
Start with two laps. Then, trunk twisters and alternating toe touches to warm up. Take the deck of cards and flip each card. Do the number of reps on the card (face cards are 10). Exceptions are Jokers, Twos and Aces
Spades – Push-ups Diamonds – Sit-Ups Hearts – Weights starting at ankles to overhead press (squatting at bottom) Clubs – Bicycles Aces – Suicides Twos – 20 Mountain Climbers Jokers – six 8-count body builders
Stretches:
Feet out front, chest toward knees Soles of feet together, chest toward ankles Right foot over left leg, elbow on outside of knee and twist – both sides Hands behind knees, roll onto back and pull knees to chest Drop knees to right and look over left shoulder; repeat on other side On all fours, place right toes on ground and press through heel to stretch calf and Achilles; switch sides Right ribs to right hip, left ribs to left hip Stand up, hand overhead, lean to right, then left Arm across chest, then elbow overhead; repeat other side
Keep the pace fast; this may not take up the whole hour, but it will tire everyone out!

item.title: Cardio Card Workout #2
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cardio Card Workout
Hearts Terminators Spades Squat Jumps Diamonds Toe Taps on Curb Clubs Hand Release Push Ups
Aces 50 jumps on jump rope Twos 5 suicides Jokers 10 Burpees

item.title: Cardio Card Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cardio Card Workout
Hearts – squats Diamonds – Push Ups Spades – alternating lunges Clubs – Bicycles (four count) Twos – 10 8-count body builders Aces – 10 jump squats Jokers – 30 mountain climbers
Face cards are 10

item.title: Cardio with Small Weights
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cardio with Small Weights
Warm up – 2 laps Trunk twisters Alternating toe touches Stretch
With both weights, do three rounds of:
20 overhead punches from squat position (up with punch, down into squat when switching arms) 20 across the body punches (with squats) 20 downward punches 10 suicides holding weights
Three rounds of:
20 bent over flies (bending knees to 90 degrees, chest on knees, weights by ankles, then raising arms parallel to ground and straightening legs) 20 squats holding weights overhead 20 alternating lunges (raising opposite arm to parallel from hip) (each lunge is one rep) 10 suicides holding weights
Three rounds of:
20 small arm circles to front (arms out to sides, parallel to ground) 20 arm circles to rear (same as above, but reversed) 20 small arm circles in (arms up overhead) 20 arm circles out (arms up overhead) 20 push ups
Three rounds of:
20 sit ups with weights on chest 20 hammers with weights in hands 20 flutter kicks
Three rounds of:
20 supermans (without weights) 20 YTA’s 20 Lois Lanes (holding hands behind back, on stomach, raising shoulders off the ground)
Stretch

item.title: Circuit Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Station One
25 push ups 25 flutter kicks 25 butt rockets Run a lap around bus lane to Station Two
Station Two (at ledge in front of auditorium)
25 dips 25 push ups on wall 25 accordian crunches Run a lap around bus lane to Station Three
Station Three
25 Mountain Climbers 30 toe taps on curb 25 jumping jacks Run a lap around the bus lane to Station Four
Station Four (on the ledge in front of auditorium)
20 Step-Ups right 20 Step-Ups left 20 Foot taps right 20 Foot taps left
Repeat Run a lap around the bus lane to station Five
Station Five
60 second Plank 20 side plank push ups (right/left) 100 crunches, alternating right and left Run a lap around the bus lane to Station Six
Station Six
20 jump squats 20 alternating lunges (right, left) 20 squats with feet pointing out Repeat Run a lap around the bus lane to Station Seven
Station Seven
Run three laps around the school Skip around bus lane to Station Eight
Station Eight
20 Supermans 20 Frankensteins 50 Situps Run a lap around the bus lane to Station One

item.title: Fireman's Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
1 hour (no resting) Workout for Firemen If you slack on this, your punishment is you get to wax the ladder truck.
REPS EXERCISE/DESCRIPTION
Jog a 10 minute warm up lap
Core Training 8 Reps Plank-On your forearms and toes come up and hold for 20 seconds. Squeeze your abs and glutes. Drop your hips to the ground and repeat. Progression 1. Lift on leg in the air Progression 2. Lift one arm straight ahead and the opposite le in the air. Do not rotate hips or back. 12 Reps YTA-On your belly lift legs entire exercise and arms in Y position legs up hold 5 seconds T position hold 5 seconds A position (imagine putting shoulder blades in back pocket)***If you hold your breath, you are WAXING THE TRUCK Jog 5 minutes
Abs Training Hit the deck on your back 12 Reps 5 second sit-ups. In crunch position with arms at your side, slowly sit up in to a full sit-up. If you came up faster than 5 seconds move your feet closer to your butt, if you cannot get up, adjust your feet away from your butt. 40 Reps Laces-in crunch position bend to your right and touch your right middle finger to your right shoe lace knot then switch to your left. That’s one. Repeat 40 times. Jog 5 minutes Upper Body 12 Reps The Perfect Push Up-On your belly place your hands on the deck as you were pulling suspenders away from your chest. Tighten your thighs, then your glutes followed by your abs and press up into a perfect push up. Pause for 2 seconds then lower yourself for 5 total seconds. Your chest must hit the same time as your NaNa. If your NaNa hits before-you did it wrong and you are waxing. 30 Reps Off balance Flys-On your back press your legs and dumbbells to the sky. Tighten your abs and keep them that way. Keep your right dumbbell up over your chest and take the left one out to butterfly position. Lower it for 3 seconds while keeping the right up in the air. Pause with the left at the bottom (not touching the deck) and as you raise the left lower the right. Repeat until you have done 15 each side. You will become slightly off balance, tighten your abs. This will keep you centered. Can you say ouch? SIR YES SIR! Thank you sir may I have another.
REPS EXERCISE/DESCRIPTION
Take a lap 20 reps Push Up Rotations- On your belly in push up position. Go all the way down to a perfect push as you come up take your right arm up in the air and rotate with it and watch your hand as it goes straight up in the air. As your hand comes back down and hits, immediately go down in to the next push up and repeat to the other side.
1 minute Farmers walk-Grab both dumbdumbs and press them to the sky to the point your biceps are almost toughing your ears. Tighten your abs and take a 1 minute walk. 8 Reps Bicep Curl Shoulder Press One Legged-Feet hip width apart abs tight starting with dumbbells at your side VERY slowly count to 10. AS you count it should take you 5 seconds to curl and 5 seconds to shoulder press. At the end of ten seconds both dumbbells should be straight up in the air. Pause for 2 seconds then lower for ten seconds in the same manner. Did I mention you were supposed to do this on one leg? You are. Again, tighten your abs and balance should not be an issue. And yes, you will feel this all over. Therefore working more muscles. Therefore burning more calories!!!
Take a lap-and make it quick
24 reps Renegade Rows-Take your dums and get in push up position. Pucker those butts and tighten those guts and press up. In push up position take your right dumbbell and pull it to your right side (almost your arm-pit). Lower (not drop) the dumbbell and repeat to the other side. PUCKER the entire time and your back will thank you.
LEGS If any of these bug your knees or lower back-take 5 laps instead
30 Reps Basic Lunges-Make sure you drop your tailbone straight to the ground and look for a 90 degree angle in each leg. 20 reps Overhead lunges- Same thing except take both dumbbells up overhead. Abs super tight-DO NOT LET DUMBELLS SWING LEFT OR RIGHT. Take your time with these. Too hard, use one dumbbell. 20 Reps Transverse Lunges-Make sure your abs are tight. As you lunge forward, touch the little toe of the forward foot using the opposite hand. I want a 90 degree bend in both legs. Take 2 laps You need to know how to run on tired legs
REPS EXERCISE/DESCRIPTION
Low Back Basic to Better Backs 20 Reps Jimmy Olsen’s-On your belly with arms stretched in front of you raise your right arm and left leg at the same time. Pause and lower. Switch. 10 Reps Superman-Same thing but with both arms and legs 10 Reps Lois Lanes (toughest exercise is named after her because after 40 year she never got her man) - Same thing except hands crossed behind your back. 10 Reps Spiderman-Spread your legs and arms out to the side. Same thing. Raise them slowly and hold for 1 second. Lower slowly. Take a lap
Stretches Age of Aquarius-Standing feet apart glutes very tight arms our to the side reach way back and let your arms fall back. Push your belly forward (super squeeze those butt cheeks to keep your back from spasming). Hold for 10 seconds. Repeat. POW Stretch. Hands locked behind your head. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and try to bring your elbows back behind you. Basic Toe Touch Stretch. Both legs in front of you as you sit except push your belly button towards your toes and keep your back from slouching. Then tighten your thighs. You will feel your hamstrings stretch as you do this. Thigh stretch-Stand holding something to keep your balance and grab one foot and try to get it to your butt. As you foot comes close tighten your abs and leg\t go of what you are holding to use your own balance. Hold for 15 seconds and switch to the other side.

item.title: Hill and Jump Rope Intense Cardio
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Workout #4 Intense Cardio and Hill Workout
Meet at the overpass to Westmoreland Street. Or, do the workout at WMS on the bigger hill in front of the school.
Take two warm up laps around the school.
20 jumping jacks 10 trunk twisters 10 alternating toe touches
Take the jump ropes to the bottom of the hill and leave them or carry them on the hill reps.
2 times up & down the hill forward 25 jumps with the jump rope 3 times up & down the hill forward 50 jumps with the jump rope 4 times up & down the hill forward 75 jumps with the jump rope 5 times up & down the hill forward 100 jumps with the jump rope 4 times up backward and down forward 75 jumps with the jump rope 3 times up backward and down forward 50 jumps with the jump rope 2 times up backward and down forward 25 jumps
5 shuffles up the hill on the right (keep butts low) (descend forward) 5 shuffles up the hill on the left (descend forward) 5 grapevines up the hill on the right (descend forward) 5 grapevines up the hill on the left (descend forward) 2 times up in a squat walk (knees bent, butts back) (descend forward) 90 second wall sit
Abs
Super set – one right after the other without a pause:
25 bicycles 25 flutter kicks 25 hello dollies 25 slapper sit-ups
Stretch and cool down Be sure to stretch your calves really well

item.title: Indoor Circuit Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Station One
25 push ups 25 flutter kicks 25 butt rockets Lunge lunge squat to Station Two
Station Two (on chairs)
25 dips (one hand on each chair) 25 push-ups on chair 30 second dip hold Lunge Lunge Squat to Station Three
Station Three
25 Mountain Climbers 30 toe taps on curb 25 jumping jacks Lunge Lunge Squat to Station Four
Station Four (on chairs)
20 Step-Ups right 20 Step-Ups left 20 Foot taps right 20 Foot taps left
Lunge Lunge Squat to station Five
Station Five
60 second Plank 20 side plank push ups (right/left) 20 Terminators, 10 right, and 10 left Lunge Lunge Squat to Station Six
Station Six
20 jump squats 20 Medicine ball sweeps 20 squats with Medicine ball alternating right /left with arms Lunge Lunge Squat to Station Seven
Station Seven
Run the stairs 10 times Lunge lunge squat to Station Eight
Station Eight
20 Supermans 20 Frankensteins 50 Situps Lunge Lunge Squat to Station One

item.title: Intense Cardio Card Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Intense Cardio Card Workout
Have everyone line up in front of the windows facing the doors. Flip the cards over and do the exercise associated with each card. Keep the pace fast.
2 10 Terminators [5 per side]
3 10 Lunges
4 10 Hand Release Push-Ups
5 10 Mountain Climbers [4 count]
6 20 second Fast Feet
7 7 Burpees
8 10 regular push ups
9 10 Flutter Kicks
10 5 Suicides
J 5 Side Shuffles (over & back= 1)
Q 10 Squat Jumps
K 30 Second Break
A 2 Bunny Hops (over & back = 1)
Jokers 3 times up & down stairs

item.title: Leg Workout with Cards
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Leg Workout with Cards
Start with two laps. Then, trunk twisters and alternating toe touches to warm up. Take the deck of cards and flip each card. Do the number of reps on the card (face cards are 10). Exceptions are Jokers, Twos and Aces
Spades – Squats Diamonds – Sit-Ups Hearts – Lunges (alternating – left & right – one on each side is one count) Clubs – Fire Hydrants (do each side for the number of reps on the card)
Aces – Suicides Twos – 20 Mountain Climbers Jokers – six 8-count body builders
Stretches:
Feet out front, chest toward knees Soles of feet together, chest toward ankles Right foot over left leg, elbow on outside of knee and twist – both sides Hands behind knees, roll onto back and pull knees to chest Drop knees to right and look over left shoulder; repeat on other side On all fours, place right toes on ground and press through heel to stretch calf and Achilles; switch sides Right ribs to right hip, left ribs to left hip Stand up, hand overhead, lean to right, then left
Keep the pace fast; this may not take up the whole hour, but it will tire everyone out!

item.title: Medicine Ball Workout #2 (Wall)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Medicine Ball Full Body Workout #2
Warm up with 2 laps around the school 25 jumping jacks 10 trunk twisters 10 alternating toe touches
Go to wall, standing about 18 inches away from wall
2 sets:
25 front wall balls (deep squat, stand up, toss ball up, catch ball, and return to squat) 25 side wall balls (right side facing wall, same as above, then left side, same as above)
Take ball back to court
20 Charlie’s Angels (10 out, 10 back) 20 Sumo Squats (10 out, 10 back)
Return to sidewalk and partner up
20 chest passes 20 side passes right side/20 left side 15 over & under (standing back to back, pass ball overhead and between your legs) 20 figure 8’s right/ 20 left
Back to your mats, with partners:
50 sit-ups with ball pass 30 seated chest passes (sit facing your partner, about two feet apart, leaning back about 45 degrees; toss the ball from your chest back and forth Back to your own mat 10 up-2-3-down-2-3 (lying on your back with ball on your lap, feet flat on the ground; roll ball up to top of knees and back down on three counts)
Cool down and stretch

item.title: Medicine Ball Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Workout #3 Medicine Ball Full Body Workout
Warm up with 2 laps around the school 25 jumping jacks 10 trunk twisters 10 alternating toe touches
Sit on mats with legs crossed
10 arches Take medicine ball in both hands and arc the ball from right knee to left & back again – over & back is one rep 15 front raises Raise ball from ground to parallel to ground and back down 15 tricep extensions – hold ball overhead with elbows facing forward; straighten arms and bend back to starting position 15 front presses Hold ball at chest level, straighten arms and press directly forward, then bend arms again 20 push ups on the medicine ball - place hands on handles, and then do regular push-ups
Run one lap around the bus lane
Take ball to bus lane
20 Charlie’s Angels (10 out, 10 back) 20 Sumo Squats (10 out, 10 back)
Run a lap around the bus lane
Return to sidewalk and partner up
20 chest passes 20 side passes right side/20 left side 15 over & under (standing back to back, pass ball overhead and between your legs) 20 figure 8’s right/ 20 left
Stand in a circle with the ball in your right hand. Raise your right hand and pass the ball to the person next to you. Do 10 passes to the right, and then 10 to the left
Back to your mats, with partners:
50 sit-ups with ball pass 30 seated chest passes (sit facing your partner, about two feet apart, leaning back about 45 degrees; toss the ball from your chest back and forth Back to your own mat 10 up-2-3-down-2-3 (lying on your back with ball on your lap, feet flat on the ground; roll ball up to top of knees and back down on three counts)
Cool down and stretch

item.title: Popsicle Stick Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Popsicle Stick Workout
Warm up with stairs or laps around the church. Trunk twisters, toe touches, arm circles, etc. to loosen up. Then:
10 rounds of:
50 jumps with jump rope 40 squats 30 sit-ups 20 hand release push ups 10 burpees

item.title: Ranger Run Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Workout #2 Ranger Run Workout
Warm up with 2 laps around the parking lot 20 jumping jacks 10 trunk twisters 10 alternating toe touches
Line up for Ranger Run Run facing traffic Run between one and two blocks between sets. Skip up the hills
Run 30 forward lunges alternating right leg/left leg Run 30 reverse lunges alternating right leg/left leg Run 20 jump squats Run 20 mountain climbers Run 30 toe taps Run 20 butt raises (sit on curb, keep in deep squat & push butt back) Run 20 side leg raises (raise right leg out to right from 12 to 24 inches off the ground, and then repeat with left side) Run 20 front leg raises (same as above, only raising leg out front instead of the side) Run
You should be back at the school by now! If you still have time, do the following:
10 terminators (plank position, push up on right hand, then left hand, down on right elbow, then left elbow) leading with right arm 10 terminators leading with left arm 20 Frankensteins 20 flutter kicks 20 accordion crunches (alternate right/left) 20 Supermans
Stretch and cool down.

item.title: Resistance Band Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Resistance Band Workout
With round bands:
Arms:
Hands inside bands, palms facing out, arms overhead. Pull out 10 times.
Hands overhead, palms facing out, keeping resistance in the band, raise and lower hands in front of your body 10 times on a five count.
Hands in front of your body, palms facing out, with thumbs in front of abs, pull band apart 10 times.
10 Bow & Arrows on each side. Hold band in one hand, pull back with opposite hand like a bow.
Place band around one quad. Palm facing your leg, pull the band out to the side 10 times.
Same as above, pulling band out in front 10 times.
Cardio:
Three sets of:
20 Mountain Climbers 20 boot slappers 20 jumping jacks
Legs:
Band around knees. Do 30 deep squats keeping resistance in bands at all times
Band around ankles. Walk around court forward toward tennis court, side (facing tennis court moving to left), backward, then side (facing tennis court moving to right) the forward back to your spot.
Go to fence. Keeping band around your ankles, put right foot forward. Lift foot forward and out 30 times. Repeat on left side.
Same exercise as above putting leg behind you. Repeat other side.
Abs:
Partner sit ups – two sets of 90 second sit ups holding partner’s legs. Switch.
Partner leg raises – holding partner’s ankles, bring your legs up to meet her hands, then bring legs back to six inches above the ground. 30 reps.
On your own mats:
25 accordion crunches, alternating right and left 100 hammers
Plank and dinner game
Stretch.

item.title: Stuck Inside Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Stuck Inside Workout
Equipment Needed: Hand Weights Medicine Ball Mat Water Staircase
Set up your equipment by placing the hand weights at the bottom of the stairs and the medicine ball and mat at the top of the stairs.
Starting at the bottom of the stairs:
March in place counting to 100 20 slow squats March in place counting to 100 20 slow squats Go up and down the stairs three times, ending at the bottom step 20 push-ups standing on floor with hands on third step – put chest to the step 20 mountain climbers keeping hands on steps from push-ups Repeat the set
Go up and down stairs three times, ending at the TOP of the stairs
Pick up Medicine Ball and do 20 lunges raising medicine ball out front and turning in direction of front leg with each lunge (like stationary Charlie’s Angels) 20 overhead extensions with medicine ball (like skull crushers) Repeat the set
Go up and down the stairs five times, ending at the bottom step
20 dips, sitting on second step from bottom 20 push-ups with hands on bottom step Repeat
Go up and down the stairs five times CARRYING HAND WEIGHTS, ending at the bottom
20 squats with weights on your shoulders 20 overhead presses Repeat
Go up and down the stairs five times CARRYING HAND WEIGHTS, ending at the bottom
20 bicep curls (three counts up, three counts down) 20 jabs (holding weights in front of chest, punching out right arm, then left – each punch is one count) Repeat
Go up and down the stairs five times CARRYING HAND WEIGHTS, ending at the top
Pick up medicine ball and do 20 single leg lunges on right, starting with ball on the right side of your knee, lifting ball overhead as you straighten leg, dropping ball to left side of knee as you lung again. Repeat on left side
Go up and down the stairs three times, ending at the bottom
20 Foot taps on right (placing right foot on third step, bringing left foot up & down for 20 counts) 20 foot taps on left
Go up and down the stairs three times, slowing down the pace, ending at the bottom
March in place 100 counts 10 push ups 10 dips
Walk up to top of stairs
Sitting on Mat, take medicine ball in both hands. Lean back 45 degrees; tap medicine ball right, then left for a 50 count
Lying on your back, feet flat on the ground, roll medicine up your knees on a three count, then down for a three count; repeat 20 times
Turn over into Plank position. Holding Plank, say the words to the National Anthem three times
Roll onto your right side, go up into Plank, and hold for a 20 count; repeat on left
Stretch out for five minutes, stretching your legs, lower back, and arms.
Make a cup of coffee or tea and relax!

item.title: Tabata Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Tabata Workout
Warm Up with one lap around the school, then do the ankle rotations, knee rotations, hip rotations, and rib rotations. Trunk twisters and alternating toe touches
Each person takes one round to time, then does the other rounds. 20 seconds work/10 seconds rest for eight rounds (total of four minutes)
The 20 second work period should be fast so that your heart rate stays elevated the entire four minutes. You should be totally winded at the end of the four minutes. If not, you aren’t working hard enough☺!
Round One:
Push-ups
Round Two
Sit-ups
Round Three
Squats
Round Four
Flutter Kicks
Round Five
Mountain Climbers
Round Six
Bicycles
Round Seven
Alternating Lunges
Round Eight
Diamond Push-ups
Finish with stretching.

item.title: Track Type Workouts for WMS
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
A couple of Track type workouts:
One
100 squats Run 1 lap (around soccer field or school) 80 sit ups Run 1 lap 60 step ups Run 1 lap 40 push ups Run 1 lap 20 burpees
Two
Track workout with cards
Hearts: Suicides Diamonds: Jump squats Spades: Sit-ups Clubs: Lunges Twos: 30 second Plank Aces: 10 Burpees

item.title: Track Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Track Workout
Warm up two laps. Stretch.
Run four laps for time, then rest for four minutes
Run three laps for time, then rest for three minutes
Run two laps for time, then rest for two minutes
Run one lap
Push yourselves on each lap. You should NOT be able to carry on a conversation during your run times.

item.title: Upper Body and Cardio Workout
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Workout #1 – Upper Body with Weights and Cardio
This is a high intensity workout. Keep the pace fast without losing your form. Do not take rests between sets and reps. The point is to keep moving at a quick pace and maintain an elevated heart rate.
2 laps around the school to warm up jumping jacks trunk twisters alternating toe touches Go to ledge
3 sets of:
20 push ups 20 dips 20 step ups (10 right, then 10 left)
Return to mats 3 sets of
20 overhead presses 20 skull crushers 10 Charlie’s Angels
3 sets of
20 biceps curls 20 upright rows 20 skaters
3 sets of
20 push ups 20 bicycles 10 jump squats (Squat deep, jump up explosively, land in squat, rest for 2 counts in squat)
3 sets of
10 tricep kickback extensions 10 lawn mowers 5 8-count body builders
************************ 90 second plank facing down 30 second plank on right side 30 second plank on left side 100 hammers 50 oblique taps with weights (sitting back at 45 degrees with one weight, tap on alternate sides, feet up) 20 slapper sit-ups, alternating right & left
Cool down stretching
